Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: Draw a rough representation of a fish shape, possibly without clear details or correct proportions.
Include some basic elements of a water environment, such as a simple wave line to represent water.
CANNOT: Correctly label the fish or its parts (student may write unrelated words or no labels at all).
Include and label other plants and animals in the habitat (student might not understand what else lives in the environment).
Show fish interacting with the habitat, like swimming or looking for food (student may draw stationary fish or unrelated actions).
Illustrate the connection between the fish and its habitat (student does not depict or understand resources fish rely on to survive).
